extendedIngredients.name: cream cheese
extendedIngredients.original: 3 packages (8 ounces each) cream cheese, softened
extendedIngredients.originalString: 3 packages (8 ounces each) cream cheese, softened

extendedIngredients.name: dark chocolate candy bars
extendedIngredients.original: As many Fun-size candy bars as you'd like, cut into quarters
extendedIngredients.originalString: As many Fun-size candy bars as you'd like, cut into quarters
extendedIngredients.originalName: As many Fun-size candy bars as you'd like, cut into quarters

extendedIngredients.name: graham cracker crumbs
extendedIngredients.original: 2 1/2 cups graham cracker crumbs (about 40 squares, crumbled)
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 1/2 cups graham cracker crumbs (about 40 squares, crumbled)

title: Fun-Size Candy Studded Cheesecake
instructions: Procedures                                                                              1                                                                            Preheat oven to 350°F.                                                                                                                             2                                                                            In a small bowl, combine the cracker crumbs, sugar, and cinnamon; stir in butter. Press onto the bottom and 2 inches up the sides of a greased 9-inch springform pan.                                                                                                                            3                                                                            Bake the crust for about 5 minutes. Remove from oven, and cool on a wire rack (do not remove from pan). Reduce oven heat to 325°F.                                                                                                                             4                                                                            In a large bowl, beat the cream cheese, sugar and vanilla until smooth. Add eggs; beat on low just until combined.                                                                                                                            5                                                                            Fold the quartered candy bars into cream cheese mixture. Pour over crust. Important: Depending on how much candy you've added, you may not want to use all of the batter because the volume has been increased. Be sure to leave one inch unfilled in the pan, to leave some room for the cheesecake to rise a bit. Bake any extra batter in cupcake liners for decadent little bites. If desired, sprinkle candy on top, too.                                                                                                                            6                                                                            Bake for 1 hour or until center is almost set. Cool on a wire rack for 10 minutes. Carefully run a knife around edge of pan to loosen; cool 1 hour longer, still in pan. Refrigerate until completely cooled, several hours or overnight.                                                                                                                            7                                                                            When ready to serve, remove the sides of the pan. To slice, use unflavored dental floss pulled taut.

steps.step: In a small bowl, combine the cracker crumbs, sugar, and cinnamon; stir in butter. Press onto the bottom and 2 inches up the sides of a greased 9-inch springform pan.
Bake the crust for about 5 minutes.
Remove from oven, and cool on a wire rack (do not remove from pan). Reduce oven heat to 325°F.
In a large bowl, beat the cream cheese, sugar and vanilla until smooth.
Add eggs; beat on low just until combined.
Fold the quartered candy bars into cream cheese mixture.

Pour over crust. Important: Depending on how much candy you've added, you may not want to use all of the batter because the volume has been increased. Be sure to leave one inch unfilled in the pan, to leave some room for the cheesecake to rise a bit.
Bake any extra batter in cupcake liners for decadent little bites. If desired, sprinkle candy on top, too.

Bake for 1 hour or until center is almost set. Cool on a wire rack for 10 minutes. Carefully run a knife around edge of pan to loosen; cool 1 hour longer, still in pan. Refrigerate until completely cooled, several hours or overnight.
When ready to serve, remove the sides of the pan. To slice, use unflavored dental floss pulled taut.
